popover.title: Welcome to i-gRINN! üçÄ
popover.description:
Welcome to i-gRINN! i-gRINN (interactive platform for (get) Residue Interaction eNergies and Networks) is a web-based tool for analysis of biomolecular dynamics simulation trajectories or conformational ensembles based on pairwise residue non-bonded interaction energies.

This interactive tutorial will guide you through submitting your first job. You'll perform real actions as we go!

popover.title: Step 1: Select Input Mode
popover.description:
Trajectory Mode: For MD simulations - requires structure (.pdb/.gro), trajectory (.xtc/.trr), and topology (.top) files.

PDB Ensemble Mode: For multi-model PDB files - topology is auto-generated.

For this tutorial, we'll use the Trajectory Mode (default).

popover.title: Load Example Data
popover.description:
Let's load some example data to test the system!

üëÜ Click the 'Load Trajectory Example Data' button to continue.

popover.title: Files Loaded! ‚úì
popover.description:
The example files have been loaded and validated. You can see:
‚Ä¢ Structure file (.pdb/.gro) - protein coordinates
‚Ä¢ Trajectory file (.xtc/.trr) - MD frames
‚Ä¢ Topology file (.top) - force field parameters
‚Ä¢ Include files (e.g. .itp) that are required by the topology file.

Note: Example data jobs are automatically set to public so they appear in the Job Queue for demonstration.

popover.title: Advanced Parameters
popover.description:
You can customize analysis parameters here. Let's take a look!

Click on Advanced Parameters button to expand the parameters panel.

popover.title: Analysis Parameters
popover.description:
Here you can configure:
‚Ä¢ Skip frames - the stride/skip to be applied to the input trajectory
‚Ä¢ Initial pair filter cutoff - distance between centers of mass of residue pairs that determines which pairs will be included in the analysis. Computed using reference input structure
‚Ä¢ Atom selections - source and target residues. By default, all atoms except for solvent, ion, and water atoms are included.

Default values work well for most analyses. Note: No protein energy network analysis will be performed when non-default values for source and/or target residue selections are used.

popover.title: Ready to Submit!
popover.description:
With all required files uploaded, the Submit button is now active (green).

üëÜ Click 'Submit Job' to start the analysis!

popover.title: Job Submitted! üéâ
popover.description:
Congratulations! Your job has been submitted to the processing queue.

You'll see a Job ID and a link to the monitoring page - bookmark it to track progress!

Tip: Use the Job Queue to see all jobs, and check Help for documentation.

Happy analyzing! üß¨
